message:
"Asynchronous" doesn't mean "running in the background" or "fire and forget". It sounds like an independent process would be best.

I've worked with logs for often-disconnected systems, and have had good success with a simple approach of rollover logging (maximum size) combined with deleting old log files based on disk space (rather than time). I have some systems with years worth of logs just because large hard drives are cheap.

I didn't sync to a central server, though. For that, I'd recommend an independent process, which can be running in the background inside your main process if you want.
